Class Quantity

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Quantity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Quantity
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains both numerical value and unit of measurement of Product and Item unit quantities
    Author:
    Nathan Standiford
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Quantity

        public Quantity(java.lang.Double value,
        Unit unit)
        Quantity constructor.
        Parameters:
        value - the value of the quantity
        unit - the unit to use
        Throws:
        QuantityNotValidException - if value less than or equal to zero and unit is not Unit.COUNT or value is not 1.0 and unit is Unit.COUNT
        PRE:
        unit != null && value != null && value > 0 && (unit == Unit.COUNT && value == 1.0 || unit != Unit.COUNT)
        POST:
        a Quantity object

        public static boolean isValidQuantity(java.lang.Double value,
                      Unit unit)
        Checks to see if value and unit are valid for a given Quantity.
        Parameters:
        value - the quantity value
        unit - the quantity unit
        Returns:
        true if value and unit can be added safely to the quantity
        PRE:
        value != null & unit != null
        POST:
        boolean indicating the validity of the arguments

        PRE:
